title: LSU beats Iowa to win 1st NCAA title
description: The Tigers fended off Iowa 102-85 in the women's national championship basketball game.

title: Britney Griner calls for the release of an American reporter detained in Russia
description: Reporter Evan Gershkovich was detained Wednesday on espionage charges. Griner was released from a Russian prison in December and has advocated for the release of Americans detained abroad.

title: What to know about Juan Merchan, the judge overseeing Trump's criminal case
description: A veteran of the New York trial court system, Merchan is no stranger to high-profile prosecutions — particularly those involving Trump and his associates.

title: A daunting recovery begins in the South and Midwest after tornadoes kill at least 26
description: Confirmed or suspected tornadoes across 10 states killed at least 26 people, destroyed homes and businesses, splintered trees and laid waste to neighborhoods over a broad swath of the country.

title: For Passover, I sent matzo to the Jews of Uganda. They've given me a gift as well
description: An American rabbi reflects on his online friendship with Jacob, a member of Uganda's Abayudaya Jewish community — and what he has learned from their conversations.

title: Ryuichi Sakamoto, a godfather of electronic pop, has died
description: The influential Japanese composer died March 28 from cancer. A wide-ranging musician, the Yellow Magic Orchestra co-founder was a synth-pop idol and the writer of sweeping movie scores.

title: Former Arkansas governor Asa Hutchinson says he is running for president
description: Hutchinson's announcement on Sunday puts him in a small Republican field that includes former President Donald Trump and former South Carolina Governor Nikki Haley.

title: From 4chan to international politics, a bug-eating conspiracy theory goes mainstream
description: The conspiracy theory alleges that a shadowy global elite conspires to control the world's population, in part by forcing them to eat insects. It's being cited by politicians in several countries.

title: Pope Francis has marked Palm Sunday in the Vatican square following his hospital stay
description: Pope Francis opened the celebration Mass in St. Peter's Square on Palm Sunday, presiding at his first ceremony after his hospital stay for bronchitis.

title: In a supreme court race like no other, Wisconsin's political future is up for grabs
description: So much in Wisconsin could depend on a single seat on the state Supreme Court. Tuesday's winner will determine the court's sway and could change the state's abortion rights and redistricting.

title: Ticks! Ick! The latest science on the red meat allergy caused by some tick bites
description: Patients who have digestive symptoms only after eating red meat may have developed an allergy caused by ticks. Previously, doctors looked for symptoms such as rashes, hives and breathing troubles.

title: Up to 70 North Atlantic right whales were spotted in Cape Cod Bay
description: As many as 70 of the endangered whales were seen feeding off the Massachusetts coast on Friday. Fewer than 350 North Atlantic right whales exist in the world.

title: UConn easily beat Miami to get to the Final Four title game
description: UConn doled out another drama-free beatdown Saturday, getting 21 points and 10 rebounds from Sanogo to dispatch Miami 72-59 and move one win from the school's fifth national title.

title: San Diego State found a last minute buzzer-beater to reach the title game
description: Lamont Butler sent San Diego State to their first national championship game with a 72-71 win over fellow mid-major Florida Atlantic in the Final Four on Saturday night.

title: The Taliban shut down Afghanistan's only women-run radio station
description: Sadai Banowan, which means "women's voice" in Dari, is Afghanistan's only women-run station. The Taliban said it was shut down for playing music during the holy month of Ramadan.
